item.title: SVGO
item.description: A pretty awesome SVG optimizer, written with Node.js. I tried it on a small logo file out of curiosity and it went down from about 3 kb to 0.5 kb, which is impressive.

item.title: Scriptlr.js
item.description: I was getting sick of adding script tags in my markup so I wrote a little script that could make it a bit more bearable. What it does is basically looping through an array of files, creating a new tag for each and every script and appends it to the body of the document. It’s obviously not meant to be used in production, but It’s quite handy when you want to play around.

item.title: Weaning yourself of jQuery
item.description: A great post on how to do basic DOM manipulation with plain Javascript instead of using jQuery. jQuery is awesome, but maybe it’s not necessary to use it if you’re only doing super simple stuff.

item.title: It's the little things
item.description:
A couple of days ago Chris Coyier wrote an interesting post asking if you can over organize your Javascript. Since I just started to learn it “properly” I decided to challenge myself by re-writing the code he had posted. He responded with this comment:

I’m not going to lie, that made me smile1.

  1. And you can officially file this post under “humble brag”.↩

item.title: My first ever pull request was a success
item.description: So yesterday I sent my first pull request ever and it actually got merged. My addition was adding a link to Airbnb’s JavaScript Style Guide in a repository that collects a bunch of styleguides. It may not be the most exciting thing ever but I guess that I can now officially call myself an open source contributor, right?
